title: Embracing Humility
devotional:
Eliza had always prided herself on her achievements. From acing exams to landing the coveted promotion at work, she attributed her success to her own hard work and intelligence. She often found herself subtly (and sometimes not so subtly) reminding others of her accomplishments. One sunny afternoon, while volunteering at a local soup kitchen, she overheard a quiet conversation. A young man, barely out of his teens, was helping an elderly woman with her meal. He spoke to her with such gentle respect and genuine care that Eliza was struck by his humility. He seemed completely unaware of his own kindness, focused only on serving the woman in front of him.

Later that evening, Eliza found herself reflecting on the encounter. She realized that true success wasn't just about personal achievements, but about how she treated others and the impact she had on their lives. She had been so busy climbing the ladder that she had forgotten to look around and see the needs of those around her. The young man's quiet act of service had revealed a profound truth: humility wasn't weakness, but strength. It was the ability to recognize her own limitations and to value the worth of others, regardless of their circumstances.

Humility is not about thinking less of ourselves, but about thinking of ourselves less. It's about recognizing that every good thing we have comes from God and that we are all interconnected, each playing a vital role in the tapestry of life. As we approach autumn, a season of harvest and gratitude, let's examine our own hearts and ask God to reveal any areas where pride may be hindering our growth. Let's strive to emulate the servant heart of Jesus, who, though being in very nature God, did not consider equality with God something to be grasped, but made himself nothing, taking the very nature of a servant (Philippians 2:6-7).
image_description: A close-up shot of a winding dirt path leading through a forest of trees displaying early autumn foliage, focusing on the texture of the path and the varied colors of the leaves.
insights: Philippians 2:3-4 encourages us to, 'Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.' This passage provides a clear definition of humility, emphasizing the importance of selflessness and prioritizing the needs of others. Furthermore, James 4:6 reminds us that 'God opposes the proud but shows favor to the humble,' highlighting the spiritual consequences of pride and the blessings that come with humility.
prayer: Heavenly Father, forgive me for the times I have allowed pride to creep into my heart. Help me to see myself as You see me – a flawed but loved child, created for a purpose. Teach me to value others above myself and to serve them with a humble and grateful heart. Grant me the strength to lay down my ego and embrace the servant spirit of Jesus. In His name, I pray. Amen.
reflection: In what areas of your life do you struggle with pride? How can you intentionally practice humility in your daily interactions? What small act of service can you perform today to demonstrate a humble heart?
